forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Areas of fog before 3am. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 30. Southwest wind around 12 mph.

forecast.name: Friday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 36. West wind 12 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 38 mph.

weather_report:
As the evening deepens over Boston, a stillness blankets the city. Areas of fog weave through the streets, draping the familiar skyline in a soft, muted haze. The temperature now dips toward thirty degrees, accompanied by a gentle southwest breeze that carries whispers of winter’s chill. Tonight’s atmosphere invites wrapping oneself in layers, perhaps slipping into a warm jacket and a cozy scarf, as the cool breath of night nips at exposed skin.

Looking ahead to tomorrow, the dawn promises a transformation. Expect mostly sunny skies to break through, brightening the day with the clarity that a fresh wind often brings. A westward gust propels the temperature just above freezing, elevating the spirits while simultaneously reminding us of the season’s briskness. This is a good time to embrace the outdoors—perhaps a stroll along the Charles River or a casual visit to one of the city’s celebrated cafés, where the warmth of coffee can easily dissolve the leftover morning chill. It is a perfect blend of fresh air and comfort, a day to relish the simple pleasures amidst the ongoing symphony of winter's beauty.
